Re: License #: CB280201014
Dear Mr. Cieslinski:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
January 17, 2024. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 R 400.12606 Training requirements. Recommended that the agency clearly
document that the prospective adoptive family received the training listed from
(a-j). In one file the training was clearly documented however in two files it was
not clear they received the training. The adoption worker reported that the
trainings were conducted for all three families together in a group setting. Each
file should contain documentation that training was provided.
 R 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation. In situations where the complete
adoptive home evaluation cannot be completed within 90 days the report should
still be written with the available information within 90 days. The report should
document why the delay will occur. When complete information is available it
should be added to complete the evaluation and the recommendation can occur
at that time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
2

Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The agency was not required to submit a corrective action plan from the renewal
audit completed in 2023. There were no barriers identified by the agency in
recruiting prospective adoptive families and completing adoption evaluations.
Financial Overview
Financial records were reviewed, including an annual budget and an annual audit
conducted by a CPA with no concerns noted.
Staff Interviews
The adoption worker reported that he continues to enjoy working for the agency
and prospective adoptive families. The Chief Administrator holds the adoption
worker in high regard and they each report enjoying working together.
Description of Agency Walk Through
CHRI documents were stored securely. The agency is in a modern well kept
building. Office space is sufficient.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
NA
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
January 29, 2024
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
